programme.title: Tech Now
programme.desc: Shiona McCallum meets the AI startup trying to fix the problem of erratic clothing sizes in fashion. Jacqui Wakefield meets the researchers developing the latest organ-on-chip technology for medical research. Paul Carter travels back in time to take a virtual reality tour of the Titanic. And Tom Gerken checks out the new Football Manager game.

programme.title: Talking Movies
programme.desc: Talking Movies turns its attention to Ireland to explore and to celebrate classic Irish cinema. Presenter Tom Brook travels to Ireland for the first time in 40 years to uncover the growth of the Irish film industry and trace its development over the recent decades into a modern and growing cultural powerhouse. Through meeting distinguished critics, journalists and film-lovers, Talking Movies revisits five Irish film classics: The Quiet Man, The Crying Game, The Snapper, Once and The Banshees of Inisherin. This special programme addresses the role they play in the canon of Irish cinema and explores their place in the wider context of Ireland's social history.

programme.title: Newsday
programme.desc: Live from Singapore, the latest international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Spotlight
programme.desc: A desperate search: now living in Omagh, Emad Al Rawashdeh cannot rest until he finds his missing daughter, son and grandchildren – all vanished while trying to flee from the Middle East. Backing him is a friend who has also experienced loss – Michael Gallagher, whose son was killed in the Omagh bombing. Jennifer O’Leary joins Emad’s search, from Tyrone to his shattered home in Syria.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest news from the BBC.

programme.title: One Week, One Title: Football in Greenland
programme.desc: Arctic conditions mean outdoor football in Greenland has to be played in a narrow window of time. BBC Sport travels to Nuuk for the Greenlandic Football Championship, an event that has wider significance to the territory than just the action on the pitch.

programme.title: The Big Cases
programme.desc: When an aristocrat and her convict partner vanish with their newborn baby, a nationwide manhunt begins. Fears for the baby’s welfare grow - until the case finally ends in tragedy. Through interviews with family, friends and witnesses, and exclusive research, we uncover the hidden backgrounds of Constance Marten and Mark Gordon, the couple on the run.

programme.title: The Interview
programme.desc: Google and the rest of the global tech industry is pouring trillions of dollars into developing artificial intelligence services. At the same time, there are real concerns of the bubble bursting and potentially unleashing huge shockwaves on the world economy. The BBC's economics editor Faisal Islam has been invited to Google's California campus to speak with the company's powerful CEO Sundar Pichai about the crucial questions raised by the technology around jobs, truth and climate change, and to look at where those huge investments are being spent.

programme.title: Newsday
programme.desc: Live from Singapore, the latest international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Review
programme.desc: BBC News remembers some of those who have left us this year.

programme.title: Newsday
programme.desc: Live from Singapore, the latest international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Talking Movies
programme.desc: One of the fastest growing sectors in tourism, both in the UK and globally, is being driven by people visiting locations that have been featured in films. In a special edition Talking Movies investigates the booming film tourism business also known as 'set jetting'. In London, Tom Brook joins a James Bond walking tour visiting key locations used in 007 films and talks to people helping to attract visitors through the capital's cinematic history. In Austria, the 1965 classic The Sound of Music brings in an estimated 300,000 visitors each year. Tom joins a group of fans who burst into spontaneous renditions of the musical's beloved songs as they travel through Salzburg's streets. The Oscar-winning picture Anora set in and around Brighton Beach in New York has resulted in a whole new wave of tourists visiting this Russian speaking community. We see some key locations used in the movie and hear from the picture's celebrated director Sean Baker on why he wanted to shoot there. And Tom visits the French town of Dinard which capitalises on movie tourism through its annual film festival in Northern France.

programme.title: Newsday
programme.desc: Live from Singapore, the latest international news from the BBC.

programme.title: AI Decoded
programme.desc: AI Decoded features Google DeepMind's Gemini Robotics lab, where researchers use artificial intelligence to enable robots to perceive, plan, think, use tools and act to better solve complex, multi-step tasks. For reaction, the AI Decoded team are joined by leading AI expert and cognitive scientist Gary Marcus to discuss what the future holds if humans are to exist alongside superintelligent machines.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest news from the BBC.

programme.title: This Cultural Life
programme.desc: Nile Rodgers, composer, producer, guitarist and founding member of Chic, talks to John Wilson about his cultural influences.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest news from the BBC.

programme.title: Talking Movies
programme.desc: Tom Brook and the Talking Movies team look back on some of the biggest film moments of the year. From the California wildfires to debates around artificial intelligence and the rise of independent cinema at this year's Oscars, it has been an eventful 12 months. Tom reflects on his personal highlights, including a behind-the-scenes look at a day in the life of a film journalist at the Cannes Film Festival and an exploration of a new wave of British cinema with first-time filmmakers Imran Perretta, Harry Lighton and Ronan Day-Lewis, directors of Ish, Pillion and Anemone. The team revisit some of their favourite films of 2025, and Emma Jones examines the growing global success of African cinema. Finally, continuing his annual tradition, Tom reveals his top ten films from the many he's watched in 2025.

programme.title: Scams & Scandals
programme.desc: An undercover investigation exposes Britain's 'Botox Wild West' - where cash comes first and safety comes last. BBC journalists, posing as beauticians, reveal a world where trusted medical professionals go rogue and rules are broken for financial gain. A nurse sells prescriptions via direct messages, a pharmacist uses dangerous shortcuts, and a fake doctor is exposed selling illegal toxins from a car boot. Patients, who have fallen victim to similar practices, reveal their ongoing suffering and life-threatening experiences. On the botox black market, trust is betrayed, and profit is placed above safety.

programme.title: The Interview
programme.desc: In his own words, Sir Anthony Hopkins describes how a deeply troubled boy from Port Talbot, Wales, achieved two-time Oscar glory in Hollywood. Deemed a failure by his parents, peers and teachers, Sir Anthony Hopkins has triumphed in memorable roles like Hannibal Lecter, King Lear and the Pope. His extraordinary journey was paved with pain, rejection and addiction but was ultimately saved by love. As his memoir is published, the actor meets Katie Razzall in Los Angeles to tell his remarkable story.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest news from the BBC.

programme.title: Talking Movies

programme.title: Newsday
programme.desc: Live from Singapore, the latest international news from the BBC.

programme.title: This Cultural Life
programme.desc: Cellist Sheku Kanneh-Mason was born in Nottingham in 1999 into a big musical family. He and his six siblings all grew up learning classical instruments and appeared on Britain’s Got Talent in 2015. Sheku first made his mark as a solo performer the following year, when he won the BBC Young Musician of the Year competition. In 2018, a global audience of over one billion watched him perform live at the wedding of the Duke and Duchess of Sussex. Since then, he has received two classical Brit awards and an MBE for services to music, and performed at the Proms every year since 2017. His book The Power of Music charts his creative journey, while his new album - his fifth release - includes recordings of works by Shostakovich and Britten. Sheku talks to John Wilson about the early influence of his paternal grandfather, a classical music lover who encouraged an appreciation of chamber music, including Schubert's Trout Quintet. He also discusses his cellist heroes, Jacqueline du Pré and Mstislav Rostropovich, and explains how the music of reggae superstar Bob Marley has been an inspiration throughout his life.

programme.title: Newsday
programme.desc: Live from Singapore, the latest international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Disclosure
programme.desc: The heartbreaking search for answers after 19-year-old Cole Cooper vanished in May. Five weeks later, his body was discovered in woodland, his death ruled ‘unexplained’. Reporter Sam Poling investigates the police response to Cole’s case and those of Rhys Bonner and Johnny Connelly – three families left desperate for the truth.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest news from the BBC.

programme.title: AI Decoded
programme.desc: OpenAI releases its latest video generation model, which it claims is more physically accurate, realistic and controllable than prior systems. While the launch has attracted much fanfare, OpenAI's latest tool is drawing praise and condemnation in equal measure. AI correspondent Marc Cieslak looks at the major technological advances made by Sora 2, as well as concerns raised over disinformation, privacy, copyright and intellectual property.

programme.desc: The latest news from the BBC.

programme.title: AI Decoded
programme.desc: AI Decoded is joined by AI safety guru Connor Leahy, who helps to explain and explore the unintended risks and also benefits of unregulated artificial intelligence. The BBC's AI correspondent Marc Cieslak also highlights the new technological achievement in how AI can generate new immersive worlds guided by a simple computer prompt. He speaks to the leading developers from Google DeepMind as well as new UK/US AI startup Odyssey.

programme.desc: (1982) Sidney J Furie's seminal horror starring Barbara Hershey. A poltergeist submits a divorced mum of three to multiple violent and sexual assaults.

programme.title: Jingle All the Way
programme.desc: (1996) Brian Levant's festive all-action comedy. Arnold Schwarzenegger is on a mission to get his son (Jake Lloyd) the must-have Christmas toy, Turbo Man. But it's sold out everywhere... [AD,S,W]

programme.title: Deck the Halls
programme.desc: (2006) Festive comedy. Neighbours Matthew Broderick and Danny DeVito get extremely competitive as they festoon their houses with increasingly outrageous fairy lights. Who'll emerge king of Christmas?

programme.title: The Black Swan
programme.desc: (1942) Swashbuckling adventure with Laird Cregar and Tyrone Power. Privateer Captain Henry Morgan tries to rid the Caribbean of pirates when he's made Governor of Jamaica. Bit rich. [S]

programme.title: Little Women
programme.desc: (2019) Greta Gerwig's Oscar-winning period drama adaptation of the classic Louisa May Alcott novel, starring Emma Watson, Saoirse Ronan, Florence Pugh, Timothée Chalamet and Meryl Streep. [AD,S]

programme.title: Sleepless in Seattle
programme.desc: (1993) Romantic comedy with Tom Hanks and Meg Ryan. A bereaved man gets another chance at love when his son puts him on a radio talk show.

programme.title: The Equalizer
programme.desc: (2014) Denzel Washington stars in Antoine Fuqua's crime thriller about an ex-Commando who comes out of retirement to help a teenage sex worker who's been assaulted by her pimp

programme.title: Withnail & I
programme.desc: (1987) Richard E Grant and Paul McGann star in Bruce Robinson's cult comedy as hapless, hard-drinking, substance-abusing unemployed actors who flee to Cumbria to escape their squalid London life

programme.title: Walking and Talking
programme.desc: (1996) Comedy with Catherine Keener and Anne Heche. A successful woman feels unlucky in love when her best friend announces that she's getting married. But is everything as rosy as it seems?

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Lady Eve
programme.desc: (1941) Screwball romcom with Barbara Stanwyck and Henry Fonda. A con artist is forced to change tack when she falls for her mark and he dumps her for trying to con him in the first place.

programme.title: The Straight Story
programme.desc: (1999) Richard Farnsworth stars in David Lynch's fact-based drama. Septuagenarian Alvin Straight travels hundreds of miles on a lawnmower to visit his estranged dying brother. With Harry Dean Stanton.

programme.title: The Golden Voyage of Sinbad
programme.desc: (1973) Can Sinbad stop a master magician from reaching the Fountain of Destiny on the lost land of Lemuria and being crowned the new leader of Marabia? [AD,S,W]

programme.title: Stormbreaker
programme.desc: (2006) Family action-thriller with Alex Pettyfer and Mickey Rourke. British intelligence recruit a schoolboy to take on the man who killed his dad and is planning to unleash a deadly virus. [AD,S,W]

programme.title: The Day the Earth Stood Still
programme.desc: (2008) Remake of the sci-fi classic with Keanu Reeves. An alien visits Earth to tell humankind to stop destroying the planet. But when he's attacked, he decides to eradicate us instead... [AD,S,W]

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Dead...
programme.desc: ...Reckoning: (2023) Tom Cruise returns as Ethan Hunt and jumps a motorbike off a mountain for real. There's some stuff about an all-powerful AI. But it's the thrills that we're here for! [AD,S,W]

programme.title: Bad Teacher
programme.desc: (2011) Naughty kids are one thing but a naughty teacher? Can titular educator Cameron Diaz win a big-bucks teaching competition... and buy surgical enhancements to seduce Justin Timberlake? [AD,S]

programme.title: Late Night with the Devil
programme.desc: (2023) Unsettling found-footage horror with David Dastmalchian. A has-been host tries to save his 70s talk show using a demonically possessed 13-year-old girl. Really, what could go wrong? [S]

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: It Came from Outer Space
programme.desc: (1953) Richard Carlson stars as an astronomer who sees an alien craft land. But nobody believes him... until the cloning begins in Jack Arnold's science-fiction classic

programme.title: Fantastic Voyage
programme.desc: (1966) Classic sci-fi adventure. Raquel Welch and Donald Pleasence are among the crew of a miniaturised submarine that's injected into an injured diplomat's body in a bid to save his life.

programme.title: The Caine Mutiny
programme.desc: (1954) Oscar-nominated Humphrey Bogart, in one of his finest roles, stars in Edward Dmytryk's gripping drama as Captain Philip Queeg, in charge of a US Navy minesweeper during the war. [AD,S]

programme.title: The Frogmen
programme.desc: (1951) Second World War thriller. Richard Widmark, Dana Andrews and Robert Wagner star as divers with a special underwater demolition team taking the war to the Japanese in the Pacific. [AD,S]

programme.title: Jerry & Marge Go Large
programme.desc: (2022) Fact-based comedy starring Bryan Cranston and Annette Bening as a retired couple who find a way to exploit a lottery loophole. But then some rich kids try to muscle in... [S]

programme.title: LA Confidential
programme.desc: (1997) Curtis Hanson's thriller of cops and corruption set in 1950s LA - with Kevin Spacey, Guy Pearce, Russell Crowe and and Oscar-winning Kim Basinger. Based on James Ellroy's detective novel.

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Hollywood
programme.desc: (2019) Quentin Tarantino's darkly comic drama set in 60s LA, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Brad Pitt and Margot Robbie. A failing actor's world collides with the Manson Family. [AD,S]

Seabiscuit
programme.desc: True story of the undersized Depression-era racehorse.

programme.title: Jack Reacher
programme.desc: When a crime is committed, all evidence points to the suspect who offers a single note: “Get Jack Reacher!”

programme.title: Deep Impact
programme.desc: The countdown to doomsday begins and the human race embarks on the fight for survival.

programme.title: Terminator Genisys
programme.desc: John Connor sends Kyle Reese back to 1984 to protect Sarah Connor. Unexpected events alter the past.

programme.title: First Blood
programme.desc: A veteran Green Beret is forced by a cruel Sheriff and his deputies to flee into the mountains.

programme.title: Rambo: First Blood II
programme.desc: John Rambo is sent on assignment back to Southeast Asia to uncover evidence of still missing POWs.

programme.title: Rambo III
programme.desc: Rambo refuses to join a mission. Trautma is captured. Rambo infiltrates the fortress to save his friend.

programme.title: Jack Reacher
programme.desc: When a crime is committed, all evidence points to the suspect who offers a single note: “Get Jack Reacher!”

programme.title: Deep Impact
programme.desc: The countdown to doomsday begins and the human race embarks on the fight for survival.

programme.title: Terminator Genisys
programme.desc: John Connor sends Kyle Reese back to 1984 to protect Sarah Connor. Unexpected events alter the past.

programme.title: First Blood
programme.desc: A veteran Green Beret is forced by a cruel Sheriff and his deputies to flee into the mountains.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Our hosts face a challenge, buy old Alpha Romeos for £1000 or less and put them through Top Gear tests

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The ultra-efficient, ultra-fast Japanese public transit is world famous. But can the Nissan GT-R prove faster?

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The Nissan GT-R is put to the test at Japan's legendary Fuji circuit. Jeremy and James compare luxury limos.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy, Richard and James take on three German motoring rivals and face their toughest challenge yet.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: In their first adventure together, Freddie Flintoff, Chris Harris, and Paddy McGuinness head to the searing heat of Ethiopia in their first cars. Back at the track, Chris puts the Ferrari 488 Pista and McLaren 600LT through their paces.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: It is an electric car special as Chris, Freddie, and Paddy each attempt to build their own battery-powered sports car on a budget. Chris tests the Tesla Model 3 on track, while Danny Boyle and Himesh Patel are the guest stars.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Chris, Freddie, and Paddy set out to turn an old hearse into the ultimate family car. On the track, Chris drives the lightweight Dallara Stradale, while Zara and Mike Tindall go head to head in the Reasonably Fast Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Paddy and Freddie head to Borneo for a jungle adventure with the Gurkhas in a pair of very rare and very cheap old cars. Chris Harris tries out the world's most luxurious SUV, the Rolls-Royce Cullinan, while Bob Mortimer is the studio guest.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff heads to Iceland to compete in the world's maddest motorsport, while Paddy McGuinness gets to grips with the new Toyota Supra. Chris Harris investigates the story of the Lotus 79, the most beautiful F1 car of all time.

programme.title: Top Gear: India Special
programme.desc: In this Top Gear special, Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond, and James May set out to boost the British economy by embarking on a trade mission to India.

programme.title: Top Gear: Special: Botswana Special
programme.desc: In this Top Gear special, Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond, and James May travel to Botswana. The boys are challenged to buy a second-hand car costing no more than £1,500 and in no way designed to go off-road and drive across the wilds of Botswana.

programme.title: Top Gear: Special: The Perfect Road Trip
programme.desc: Seven days, more than 1,000 miles, 20 cars, two boats, a motorbike, and one dream. It all adds up to the perfect road trip for Top Gear stars Jeremy Clarkson and Richard Hammond.

programme.title: Blitz
programme.desc: A tough cop (Jason Statham) goes after a serial killer who targets police officers.

programme.title: Allies
programme.desc: An American captain (Julian Ovenden) and a British sergeant (Chris Reilly) must put aside their personal animosity to carry out a mission that has the potential to shorten World War II.

programme.title: The Railway Man
programme.desc: Eric Lomax (Colin Firth), a former British army officer and POW, discovers that the Japanese interpreter who tortured him is still alive. He and his new wife (Nicole Kidman) set out to confront the man who caused him so much pain.

programme.title: USS Indianapolis: Men of Courage
programme.desc: After their ship is torpedoed by a Japanese submarine, the crew members of the USS Indianapolis face a harrowing nightmare as their ship goes down in the shark infested Philippine Sea.

programme.title: Allies
programme.desc: An American captain (Julian Ovenden) and a British sergeant (Chris Reilly) must put aside their personal animosity to carry out a mission that has the potential to shorten World War II.

programme.title: The Railway Man
programme.desc: Eric Lomax (Colin Firth), a former British army officer and POW, discovers that the Japanese interpreter who tortured him is still alive. He and his new wife (Nicole Kidman) set out to confront the man who caused him so much pain.

programme.title: Churchill
programme.desc: British Prime Minister Winston Churchill clashes with his political opponents as D-Day nears in June 1944. Clementine, his devoted wife, tries to prevent his physical, mental and spiritual collapse while inspiring him to achieve greatness.

programme.title: Top Gear UK
programme.desc: James May makes a rare visit to the test track in the insane Aerial Atom V8. Contains Strong Language.

programme.title: Top Gear UK
programme.desc: The team go against their Australian counterparts. Contains Strong Language.

programme.title: Top Gear UK
programme.desc: Jeremy, Richard and James head to Albania to test a trio of super luxurious cars. Contains Strong Language.

programme.title: Top Gear UK
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson takes the insanely powerful Pagani Zonda R out on the test track. Contains Strong Language.

programme.title: Top Gear UK
programme.desc: The presenters battle the chaos and misery that snowfall brings to Britain. Contains Strong Language.

programme.title: Top Gear UK
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson races the Jaguar XJ against the rotation of the Earth itself. Contains Strong Language.

programme.title: Top Gear UK
programme.desc: Richard tests an alternative to the Hummer. Contains Strong Language.

programme.title: Top Gear UK
programme.desc: The boys argue their way around Italy as they attempt to find the best hatchback. Contains Strong Language.

programme.title: Top Gear UK
programme.desc: Rival supercars from Ferrari and McLaren go head-to-head on the test track. Contains Strong Language.

programme.title: Top Gear UK
programme.desc: Could the traditional train ever be replaced by a load of caravans pulled by a car? Contains Strong Language.

programme.title: Top Gear UK
programme.desc: Jeremy, Richard and James race against time to knock down a row of derelict houses. Contains Strong Language.

programme.title: Top Gear UK
programme.desc: Jeremy and James take a very British trip to the seaside in two electric cars. Contains Strong Language.

programme.title: The Baytown Outlaws
programme.desc: Three infamous brothers from Alabama stir up a whole lot of trouble with crooked cops, mobsters and more when they try to accomplish a single good deed.

programme.title: Finding Steve McQueen
programme.desc: The FBI launches its biggest manhunt when an unlikely gang of thieves tries to steal $30 million in illegal campaign contributions from President Richard Nixon's secret fund.

programme.title: Life of Crime
programme.desc: Double-crosses and plot twists abound when a corrupt real-estate developer (Tim Robbins) decides not to pay a ransom to his wife's (Jennifer Aniston) kidnappers (John Hawkes, Yasiin Bey).

programme.title: Cold Pursuit
programme.desc: Nels Coxman's quiet life as a snowplow driver comes crashing down when his beloved son dies under mysterious circumstances. His search for the truth soon becomes a quest for revenge against a psychotic drug lord named Viking and his sleazy henchmen.

programme.title: John Wick
programme.desc: New York City becomes the bullet-riddled playground of a former assassin (Keanu Reeves) as he hunts down the Russian mobsters who destroyed everything he held dear.

programme.title: John Wick: Chapter 2
programme.desc: Legendary hit man John Wick comes out of retirement when a former associate plots to seize control of an international assassins' guild. Bound by a blood oath to help him, Wick travels to Rome to square off against the world's deadliest killers.

programme.title: John Wick: Chapter 3 -- Parabellum
programme.desc: Stripped of the High Table's protective services, legendary hit man John Wick must fight his way through the streets of New York as the world's most ruthless killers try to collect the $14 million bounty on his head.

programme.title: John Wick
programme.desc: New York City becomes the bullet-riddled playground of a former assassin (Keanu Reeves) as he hunts down the Russian mobsters who destroyed everything he held dear.
